title: Yorick nerf compared to Garen nerf
body:
Balance team :
We will hit the core of {{champion:83}} kit which is his ghouls.

Same Balance team :
We will just decrease some of {{champion:86}} Q damage but not touch his core kit either in his stupid tenacity and damage reduction on  W or his passive post level 11.

I will tell you what is wrong with low elo , it not {{champion:83}} damage cause low elo people know that {{champion:58}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:240}} stomp him in lane.
Their problem that they try to 5 man push mid and failing over and over while leaving {{champion:83}} pushing top lane freely without any true counter to that in mid push or stopping him top.

But again you are the worst balance team, you just decrease some champion Q damage while his problem is his W and passive while other get direct hit into his core kit just cause people can't handle split pushing that not related to his core kit.

I don't really mind that they didn't nerf Garen's "core kit".
What absolutely infuriates me though is how they're clearly just trolling us at this point.

> "Garen's spun his way into top lane dominance as of late, and Q's early game damage leaves opponents with few opportunities to trade well."

And proceeds to: 
>Q - Decisive Strike
BASE DAMAGE 30/65/100/135/170 ⇒ 30/60/90/120/150 

Nerf the damage of his Q only when lane phase is already over.
They're quite frankly just making fun of us.

BASE DAMAGE 30/65/100/135/170 ⇒ 10/40/90/130/170

Here with Q nerf late, I think their goal is to promote max E first (and by doing that delaying stronger silence early) but they should move a bit more power from Q to E to be sure that this happens

q max was meta before they buffed it. the recent nerf partially reverted the q buff. q max is still going to be meta.

there is no reason to max e, because it scales more with champion level than ability rank. it is only very specific matchups like shen for example who can absorb your q with his w, where e max makes sense. even in that specific case its not great, because shens shield can absorb most of it early on.

thats why we maxed q since season 5.
Laning phase isn't over at level 5, you know. It's already -10 dmg/Q @ Lvl 5.  And -20 dmg / Q @ Lvl 9, which is still before the end of laning phase most of the time.
You get max ability at level 8 silly. 1st goes in to Q, then E then W, then Q Q then R then Q then E again then Q finally to max it out.

And at level 5, so with your Q Rank 3, it's already -10 dmg.

Plus, you get your first ability maxed at level 9, not 8. There are 9 letters in your own sentence, just count them out...

Garen isn't really an issue at super early levels though, it is the fact that he maxes Q first that made him a pain to fight.  Thus nerfing how much damage the first ability he maxes does actually makes perfectly good sense.
Maybe garen isnt an issue early, because as a tank, he scales excellently, and thus shouldn't be an issue early ever under any circumstances
Maybe that is exactly why he is getting nerfed?

Honestly for a long time I've always thought the biggest problem with Garen is the length of the silence on his Q, not the actual damage he puts out. You basically have to sit there and take his whole combo because he hit you with an enhanced auto. Where's the ability to outplay that other than wait out the duration(which is nearly 5 seconds btw)?

They should have either nerfed him like they nerfed Yasuo(lower duration on Q before it wears off), or nerfed the silence duration.

> Where's the ability to outplay that other than wait out the duration(which is nearly 5 seconds btw)?

First off it's only 1.5 seconds at all ranks.

Second off the counter play is to not let the second most immobile champion that is 100% melee range walk up to you and stab you in the face. Besides Mord, Garen is the easiest champion to kite.

Literally every champion in the game (other than mord) has more mobility and/or cc to allow them to get to their target or run from said target. Garen has a scaling 1.5 - 3.5 MS buff followed by a 1.5s silence IF you let him walk up to you and slap you.

That counterplay falls flat when you are playing a champion that also needs to be in your face to do damage, and they silence you for nearly the entire duration of their E, and no, the duration is 6 seconds at all ranks(now that I've accurately timed it, apparently the 1.5 second break free from all slows doesn't count into the 4.5 seconds you get to wait for the next auto attack, so it lasts 6 seconds), that's how long his Q lasts. The SILENCE lasts 1.5 seconds. There's no other champion in the game I can think of that can literally force you to eat his or her entire combo if he/she gets on top of you. You can usually flash or do something. Garen needs to be remade into something with more interactive gameplay, because playing against him is always literally waiting for him to waste his Q to be able to act, or being forced to go to other lanes and impact them elsewhere, and if he doesn't then you die.
